update.description:
The depth camera sensor currently assumes that depth data is always available, which is not  the case, .e.g when the requests for point cloud data instead of depth data.

I ran into this problem when reviewing pull request #3194. I tried to visualize depth data but forgot that it’s actually not generating any depth images.

To test, apply this patch to depth\_camera.world to let the depth sensor to generate point clouds:

```
diff -r f0d3578207d5 worlds/depth_camera.world
--- a/worlds/depth_camera.world	Fri Jan 31 13:51:10 2020 -0800
+++ b/worlds/depth_camera.world	Mon Feb 24 16:10:14 2020 -0800
@@ -73,6 +73,9 @@
               <near>0.1</near>
               <far>20</far>
             </clip>
+            <depth_camera>
+              <output>points</output>
+            </depth_camera>
           </camera>
           <plugin filename="libDepthCameraPlugin.so" name="depth_camera_plugin" />
           <always_on>true</always_on>
```

Launch gazebo with this world, go to the Topic Visualization window \(ctrl \+ t\), select the depth camera image topic and gazebo should crash without the changes in this PR.
update.title: Prevent crash when subscribing to depth camera image topic

pull_request.title: Prevent crash when subscribing to depth camera image topic

pullrequest.title: Prevent crash when subscribing to depth camera image topic

content.raw: Fixes the crash for me. One thing to consider in the future is to not even advertise the image topic if it's not going to be published.
content.html: Fixes the crash for me. One thing to consider in the future is to not even advertise the image topic if it's not going to be published.

pull_request.title: Prevent crash when subscribing to depth camera image topic
